message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the problem of pedestrian attribute recognition in surveillance images, which is a subfield of computer vision. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a Joint Recurrent Learning (JRL) model that learns pedestrian attribute correlations and their sequential ordering dependencies in an end-to-end encoder/decoder recurrent network. This involves exploring attribute context and correlation, which is a task that can be tackled using machine learning techniques such as deep learning. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also evaluates the performance of the JRL model on two pedestrian attribute benchmarks, which involves multi-label image classification and multi-person image annotation. Therefore, cs.MM (Multimedia) is another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the problem of recognising semantic pedestrian attributes in surveillance images, which is a security-related application. Therefore, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is a less likely but still possible sub-category.
